intro: Gnaphalium glumaceum, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy white to pale yellow flowers that are often used in floral arrangements due to their long-lasting nature. Its leaves are silvery-gray, covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium glumaceum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
